title.narrative: Provision of integrated emergency shelter, WASH, CCCM and protection services for the newly arrived IDPs in Maaret Tamsrin through the establishment, operation and management of 2 IDP settlements.

description.narrative: The project will provide integrated emergency shelter, WASH, CCCM and protection response for the newly displaced population in Idleb through the establishment and management of 2 camps with delivery of basic humanitarian services. BINAA selected the location for camps as far as possible from front lines in south Idleb and western Aleppo and ensured that the lands meet the topographical, soil type, drainage, water resources and environmental requirements. After selecting camp location, BINAA collected the HLP documents for lands including: Tabou and donation statement from the landlord verified by the real estate directorate in Idleb. Also, BINAA requested forming expertise committee from the real estate directorate to determine the exact borders of the lands and issue the topographical drawing with contour lines. BINAA conducted HLP Due Diligence Checklist and approved by the CCCM cluster with three key persons to ensure that there are no problems with the selected land (Attachment 1). BINAA engineering team prepared AutoCAD drawings considering: site planning guidelines meet the minimum standards regarding the camp size, sphere emergency standards for planning camps, indicative module planning unit, and site planning standards for services and infrastructures in addition to: Adequate spaces around tents 5*4 m tents to meet sphere standards Green spaces and gardens School and medical point Well designed streets for easy movement Safety and security points Camp management center Aid distribution point Camp fence with clear entry and exit points to ensure security and organization. Installation of street lighting poles every 35 meters in the pathways to ensure safe access to the camp's services. BINAA will use the soil and rocks that will be produced from leveling and excavation the site and pathways in graveling and leveling the tents. The pathways will be equipped with a rain drainage system. WASH Infrastructure will be prepared including: Underground infrastructure preparation: septic tanks, potable water network and main ground water tank which will be built in the highest point of the land to allow a natural flow of the water. Water supply: The water tank will be supplied with water from a well in nearby village equipped with water pump to pump and sterilize water. Then constructing a polyethylene network between the main tank and the small tanks distributed in the camp. Water network points: Establishment of 168 water tanks (2000 liter), each group of tents has their own water tank. Establishment of 75 latrine blocks (each group of tents has their separate latrine blocks), Each block composed of lockable bathrooms and latrines (seperate units for males and females and special units for people with disabilities). The design was prepared with consideration to protection and privacy issues (entrances, solar lights, ramps, handrails, toilet seat, handrails, signboards, lead reflective tapes and arrows, gender signs) (Attachment 5). Underground separate septic tank will be constructed for each Block (10M3 capacity). Distribution of waste containers with 100-liter capacity to safe locations to collect the solid waste in the camp. Water well equipment: submersible pump with related panel, cables, pipes and valves, and generator 150 KVA. All tents will be provided with internal and external isolation after installation, graveling and leveling work will be conducted before tent installation, BINAA will distribute NFI kit (contain HK) for each family. NFI kits will be provided from the contingency stock in coordination with the SNFI cluster. Each tent will be provided with a solar system for lighting and phone charging purposes. Also, BINAA will establish protection helpdesk and mobile outreach team to refer cases to specialized service and case management team to deliver GBV awareness raising sessions.
